snippet: The Top 100 tours in North America last year sold $2.34 billion in tickets, an increase of 6.3 percent. U2 led the way with $156 million in gross ticket sales, followed by Taylor Swift and Kenny Chesney.
abstract: The Top 100 tours in North America last year sold $2.34 billion in tickets, an increase of 6.3 percent. U2 led the way with $156 million in gross ticket sales, followed by Taylor Swift and Kenny Chesney.

headline.main: Concert Revenue Was Up in 2011, Led by U2
